Title: GOODHOME
Article: A USWEB/CKS project, under the Creative Direction of Tim Kain. I was hired to develop a Flash navigation system for the site, as well as site design and production for the lower levels of the site to fill in. The overall look and feel is airy and clean and achieved the client?s expectations by suggesting a desirable lifestyle to the user. This project was also delivered on an extremely tight schedule of about 8 weeks for both design and development.

Title: SATURN.COM REDESIGN
Article: Saturn was a new client to Deutsch LA, and I was brought aboard for my previous successes with Toyota, Nissan, and Infiniti, to concept and create the Homepage for this car client.  Using the latest FLV streaming techniques, the user experience is carefully loaded with control over the information-needs of visiting users and then delivers a user-driven video and still-photo introduction to each of the five vehicles.  This both was a way for me to repurpose the available very-rough footage that the client already had, and also help consumers identify the vehicle to the vehicles name.

Title: TGIFRIDAYS.COM
Article: TGIFridays looked to Deutsch LA to redesign and reinvigorate their online site and menu/information architecture.  My role was in the creation of the Homepage, Drinks section, and dynamic flash menu and image throughout the site with a development schedule of two weeks. The timeline required an experienced sure-hand on the server-side and DHTML provided by Kish Hiranand, and design by Todd Swaim.

Title: TOYOTA PRIUS HSD
Article: Created to introduce the Prius, and a whole new kind of car, our goal was to create a surreal city of blue sky and information about the new Prius. Using parallax and filtered 3D cell-shaded objects, this site was a success and helped to start the green movement.
